question: Who won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 2024?
option_1: John Hopfield and Geoffrey Hinton
option_2: David Baker and Demis Hassabis
option_3: Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun
option_4: Anne L‚ÄôHuillier and Pierre Agostini
solution:
The 2024 Nobel Prize in Physics was jointly awarded to John J. Hopfield and Geoffrey E. Hinton for their foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks.

  • üß†John Hopfield developed the Hopfield network, a type of recurrent neural network used for associative memory and pattern reconstruction.
  • üß†Geoffrey Hinton pioneered the Boltzmann machine and advanced deep learning techniques that revolutionized artificial intelligence.

Their work laid the groundwork for modern machine learning, impacting fields like image recognition, natural language processing, and autonomous systems.

The prize was announced by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences on 8 October 2024, and the laureates shared a cash award of 11 million Swedish kronor.

question: Who won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2024?
solution:
The 2024 Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded to Han Kang, a South Korean author, ‚Äúfor her intense poetic prose that confronts historical traumas and exposes the fragility of human life.‚Äù

  • üìö Han Kang is known for works such as The Vegetarian, Human Acts, The White Book, and Greek Lessons
  • She is the first South Korean and first Asian woman to win the Nobel Prize in Literature
  • The award was announced by the Swedish Academy on 10 October 2024 and presented on 10 December 2024 in Stockholm
  • Her writing is celebrated for its lyrical style and emotional depth, often exploring themes of pain, memory, and identity

question: Which state topped the overall medal tally in the Khelo India Youth Games 2025?
solution:
The Khelo India Youth Games 2025 were hosted across five cities of Bihar: Patna, Rajgir, Gaya, Bhagalpur, and Begusarai, showcasing the state's growing sports infrastructure.

In this edition, Maharashtra topped the overall medal tally with 158 medals (comprising 58 Gold, 47 Silver, and 53 Bronze), followed by Haryana with 117 medals, and Rajasthan with 60 medals. A total of 26 new records were set during the games, including 5 national youth records in weightlifting by girls ‚Äî which was a standout achievement. The mascot 'Gajasimha' symbolized strength and courage, adding cultural pride to the event.

This event is a part of the Government of India‚Äôs flagship initiative ‚ÄòKhelo India‚Äô, launched to promote grassroots sports development and identify talent at the national level.

question: Which country won both the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs titles in the first-ever Kho Kho World Cup 2025?

question: Which medal did Neeraj Chopra win at the Paris Diamond League 2025?

question: Who won the 72nd Miss World 2025 title?
solution:
Opal Suchata Chuangsri from Thailand won the 72nd Miss World 2025 title. This was the first-ever Miss World title for Thailand, making it a historic win. The event was held in Hyderabad, India, and the previous winner in 2024 was Krystyna Pyszkova from Czech Republic.

question: Who won the 73rd Miss Universe 2024 title?

Victoria Kjaer Theilvig from Denmark won the 73rd Miss Universe 2024 title. The event was held at Arena CDMX, Mexico City. This is a significant achievement for Denmark. For reference, Lara Dutta (India) won the title in 2000, and Sushmita Sen (India) won it in 1994.

question: Who won the Mrs. World 2025 title?

üî∏Difference between Miss World and Mrs. World:

question: Who won the Mrs. Universe 2024 title?

question: Who received the Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award in 2025?
solution: Kumar Mangalam Birla received the Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award in 2025, making him the 4th recipient of this prestigious honor. The award was instituted in 2022 to commemorate the legacy of Lata Mangeshkar, with Narendra Modi being the 1st recipient in 2022, followed by Asha Bhosle in 2023 and Amitabh Bachchan in 2024.

question: Who received the Dadasaheb Phalke Lifetime Achievement Award for the year 2022?
solution:
Mithun Chakraborty was honored with the Dadasaheb Phalke Lifetime Achievement Award for 2022, India‚Äôs highest recognition in cinema. The award was announced by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting and presented at the 70th National Film Awards ceremony. Mithun Da‚Äôs cinematic journey spans over 350 films across multiple languages, and he is known for iconic roles in films like Disco Dancer, Agneepath, Tahader Katha, and Swami Vivekananda. He is also a three-time National Film Award winner and a recipient of the Padma Bhushan.

question: Which film won the Best Film award at the 97th Oscar Awards in 2025?

question: Who won the Chameli Devi Jain Award in 2025?

question: Which of the following is a winner of the Ramon Magsaysay Award 2024?

question: Who became the first Indian to win the Best Actress award at the Cannes Film Festival 2024?
solution: Anasuya Sengupta made history by becoming the first Indian to win the Best Actress award at the Cannes Film Festival 2024 for her performance in the film The Shameless. This achievement brought immense pride to the nation and highlighted Indian talent on a global stage.

question: Which country conferred the Mitra Vibhushana honour on Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2025?
solution: In 2025, Sri Lanka conferred its highest civilian honour, the Mitra Vibhushana, on Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his enduring contribution to strengthening India‚ÄìSri Lanka friendship. The award was presented by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake during a ceremony at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo. This was the first time an Indian leader received this honour, which symbolizes deep cultural ties and shared Buddhist heritage between the two nations.

question: Which country conferred the Order of the Star and Key of the Indian Ocean on Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2025?
solution: In 2025, Mauritius conferred its highest civilian honour, the Order of the Star and Key of the Indian Ocean, on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The award was presented by President Dharambeer Gokhool during Mauritius‚Äôs National Day celebrations in Port Louis. Modi became the first Indian leader to receive this prestigious honour, recognizing his efforts to strengthen India‚ÄìMauritius ties and shared cultural heritage.

question: Which country conferred the Order of St. Andrew the Apostle on Prime Minister Narendra Modi?
solution: Russia conferred its highest civilian honour, the Order of St. Andrew the Apostle, on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The award was presented by President Vladimir Putin during a ceremony at the Kremlin in Moscow on July 9, 2024. This prestigious honour recognized Modi‚Äôs exceptional contributions to strengthening the strategic partnership and fostering friendly relations between India and Russia. The Order, established in 1698 by Tsar Peter the Great, is Russia‚Äôs oldest and most distinguished award.
